alert.note: Alert for Cheatham; Davidson; Robertson; Sumner (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 10:58AM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Davidson, southwestern Sumner, northeastern Cheatham and southern Robertson Counties through 1130 AM CDT... At 1057 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Coopertown, or 9 miles southwest of Springfield, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Springfield, Ashland City, Madison, Hendersonville, Goodlettsville, White House, Millersville, Greenbrier, Coopertown, Lakewood, Ridgetop, Hermitage, Old Hickory, Joelton, Pleasant View, Whites Creek, Cottontown and Beaman Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 near mile marker 219. Interstate 65 between mile markers 86 and 111. Interstate 24 between mile markers 22 and 47. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 PM CDT for Middle Tennessee.
